intro: Icomum lineare, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. This plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. It is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Icomum lineare plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
